info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 07 at 7:40AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Forest Service West Central Montana Avalanche Center Missoula MT ...The Forest Service West Central Montana Avalanche Center Missoula MT has continued a Backcountry Avalanche Warning... * WHAT...The avalanche danger is HIGH. The likelihood of avalanches will increase with continued wind, snowfall, rising temperatures and rain at lower elevations. * WHERE...Across the West Central Montana forecast area, including Lolo Pass, southern and central Bitterroot, Rattlesnake, southern Missions and southern Swan Mountains near Seeley Lake MT. All elevations will be impacted by heavy snow and elevated avalanche hazard. * WHEN...In effect until 7 AM MST Saturday * IMPACTS...Continued snowfall, rising temperatures, and strong winds are increasing the avalanche hazard.
info.instruction: Very dangerous avalanche conditions. Travel on avalanche terrain is not recommended. Avalanches may run long distances and can run to valley floors, or flat terrain. Wet snow could produce avalanches at low elevations where not normally encountered. Consult http://www.missoulaavalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of any Avalanche Center.
